Title: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection, 1567-1882
Description.abstract: This collection consists of manuscript documents in Spanish and Nahuatl from the town of Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico). The documents consist primarily of civil litigation case files, but also include a small amount of criminal case files and several government printed broadsides.
AltTitle.other: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection|~|Tulancingo Manuscript Collection

Title: Documents relating to the Sebastian Vazquez case, and others
Description.abstract: Incomplete set of documents relating to the case of Sebastian Bazquez [Vazquez], who claimed ownership of indigenous land. Includes unrelated material, such as Nahuatl petitions.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Pedro de Ontiveros vs. debtors
Description.abstract: Documents relating to Pedro de Ontiveros' demand that indigenous men fully repay the 100 pesos he loaned them, of which he had only received half. Text mainly in Spanish and includes an admittance of debt (conocimiento) in Nahuatl, partially on one leaf.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Notice of bail for Gabriel Bazquez and Don Juan Lorenço de San Francisco
Description.abstract: Two indigenous officials, Don Gabriel Bazquez and Don Juan Lorenço de San Francisco were in jail for non- payment of tribute; they were later freed on bail (fianzas).

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Gomes Family land titles
Description.abstract: Collection of documents concerning the Gomes family landholdings. The majority of the leaves (19) are records of land sales in Nahuatl, the rest are in Spanish.
Description.note: (FF.20-1 are transcribed and translated in Lockhart 1991, pp. 97-101).

Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Bernardina Gutierrez vs. Domingo Hernandez
Description.abstract: Documents regarding a dispute between Bernardina Gutierrez and her son, Domingo Hernandez, over an hacienda which she had rented out to him. Gutierrez wants the hacienda back, and livestock and pesos owed.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Sale and transfer of titles for Indigenous land
Description.abstract: Documents relating to the sale and transfer of ownership of land between four indigenous owners: Gaspar de Santiago, Diego de Mendosa, Juan de Ayala and Francisco Lario Gomez.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Documents relating to the estate of Don Juan Manuel Basquez, and others
Description.abstract: Doña Josepha Catharina Franco, widow of Don Juan Manuel Basquez, initiated litigation to settle debts owed to her deceased husband. File includes a list of debtors, acknowledgements of debt, and documents relating to the landholdings of Luis Santos.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Compilation of petitions, and Will of Ysabel Clara
Description.abstract: Varied and colorful collection of petitions presented to the alcalde mayor. Includes cases involving local merchants, a land dispute, a rape allegation, and the abduction of a wife. Issues concern both indigenous and Spanish residents.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Declaracion en favor de Maria Augustina de la Cruz, de Temascatitla
Description.abstract: Two copies of an original document in Nahuatl; one was transcribed from the original Nahuatl ca. 1722 - 1723; the other is a translation into Spanish made in 1777. The text contains an indigenous cabildo's confirmation about a plot of land.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Doña Juana de Bargas Machuca vs. Santiago Joseph de Galicia
Description.abstract: Documents relating to the dispute between the aged widow Doña Juana de Bargas Machuca and the indigenous man Don Santiago Joseph de Galicia. Dispute pertains to an apple orchard and includes witness testimonies.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Will of Domingo de la Cruz, and Statement on the death of Domingo Rosales
Description.abstract: Will of Domingo de la Cruz including text relating to the death of an indigenous man, Domingo Rosales.

Title: Broadside
Description.abstract: Broadside announcement. On recto: record of a land sale by Luis José Casares to his cousin; record ordering a new election for indigenous leadership positions, with a list of names (possibly candidates).

Title: Box ?, Folder 5
Description.abstract: "Bula de composicion para los Reynos de Indias."

Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Folder 6
Description.abstract: Anachronistic compilation of petitions, sewn together. Most were presented to the alcalde mayor (chief magistrate), Don Pedro Ladron de Guevara. Documents primarily concern economic or material redress and reference the districts of Singuilucan, Acatlán.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Folder 8
Description.abstract: Documents relating to the suit of Don Martín Cortés, Marqués del Valle, versus Hernando de Paz over the estancia of Acatlán. Cover page indicates the documents contain the "probanzas y testimonios" of the case. Case file begins with the original decision.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Box 1, Folder 9
Description.abstract: Incomplete copy of the dowry of Doña Catalina de Arellano, in her marriage to Francisco de Terrazas, encomendero of Tulancingo (and Jaltepec?); no date given for transcription; Arellano received 22,000 gold pesos.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Box 1, Folder 12
Description.abstract: Case documents relating to Francisco de Terrazas, encomendero of Tulancingo, who charged Diego de Suares de Peredo with the theft of six colts. Includes documents that do not relate directly to the case but do refer to Terrazas.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Box 1, Folder 16
Description.abstract: Compilation of documents relating to the estate of Pedro de la Mora and Doña Felipa de Arteaga. Their daughter Doña Maria Ordoñez petitioned her uncle Andres de la Mora for the release of these papers so the possessions could be divided amongst the heirs

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Box 1, Folder 20
Description.abstract: Provision from the Real Audiencia. Diego Lopez de Escobar was the guardian ad litem for the children of Juan Vibaldo [Bibaldo] de Mirabal and Ynes de Escobar, both deceased. The court ruled against Antonio de Mendoça.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Folder 22
Description.abstract: Provision from the Real Audiencia concerning the criminal case of Francisco Ordoñez and his wife Cathalina Dominguez versus Miguel Caro. Caro was found guilty of assaulting Cathalina; he was sentenced and paid his bail.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.
Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Folder 24
Description.abstract: Provision from the Real Audiencia. Ana Gomes Montte Agudo was in a dispute with Juan Sanches de Montoya, a local merchant, over her deceased husband's debt. With the official seal and signatures of the oidores.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.

Title: Folder 26
Description.abstract: Document concerning the mill of Santiago (Molino de Santiago) in Tulantepec.

Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Folder 27
Description.abstract: Estate inventory indicating the monetary values of Baños' personal property, including houses on a hacienda named Guaxomulco. Prepared by Francisco de Medel, a local merchant.

Title: Folder 30
Description.abstract: Documents relating to a dispute of ownership over a hacienda named Ysptlaguacan [Ixtlahuacan]. Property belonged to Francisco Lopez de Medina, and was inherited by his children, Cristobal Hernandes and Clara de Fonseca. Antonio de Espinosa, a resident o

Relation.isPartOf: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA
Title: Pedro Gonzales de Paredes vs. debtors
Description.abstract: Indigenous men promised to repay Pedro Gonzales de Paredes 17 fánegas of maize for a monetary loan; Paredes successfully litigated to force payment.

Subject: Indians of Mexico --Legal status, laws, etc.--History--Sources|~|Nahuatl language --Texts|~|Mexico--History--Spanish colony, 1540-1810--Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --Trials, litigation, etc. --Archival resources.|~|Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico) --History --Sources.

Title: Juan Cuetlachcohuacatl vs. Marcos de Torres
Description.abstract: A dispute between Juan Cuetlachcohuacatl and Marcos de Torres, trustee for the estate of Don Diego Alexandrino, over the ownership of a piece of land. File includes witness testimonies.
